Staff List Feedback and Suggestions Submit Classified Ad Submit Letter Submit Event Submit News Tip Submit Obituary Job Opportunities User Agreement Staff List About Us **Driver cited after crash in wet conditions on Rt. 309 in Lynn Twp.** A driver and two passengers were transported from the scene of a one-vehicle crash at 11:12 a.m. May 16 on Route 309 in Lynn Township, state police at the Fogelsville barracks said. Elizabeth M. Medina, 40, of Shamokin, the driver, and passengers Christian Medina, 35, also of Shamokin, and Christian Medina Jr., 21, of Coal Township, were transported to an area hospital by personnel from the Cetronia Ambulance Corps, police said. The crash occurred when the 2003 Honda Element was southbound and the driver lost control of it on the wet road. The vehicle traveled across the northbound lanes, exited the road and hit an embankment before traveling back onto the road and rolling over. The vehicle had disabling damage. Elizabeth Medina was cited after the crash, according to police. **Bowmanstown man charged with viewing child porn** **Bowmanstown man charged with viewing child porn** **Towamensing tables storage unit plan, elects chief** **Towamensing tables storage unit plan, elects chief** **Carbon honors Children and Youth workers** **Carbon honors Children and Youth workers** **Donation to Legion** **Donation to Legion** **Palmerton Girl Scout earns Bronze Award** **Palmerton Girl Scout earns Bronze Award** **Bowmanstown man charged with viewing child porn** **Bowmanstown man charged with viewing child porn** **Raid in Bowmanstown** **Raid in Bowmanstown** **Marian community mourns death of Malarkey** **Marian community mourns death of Malarkey** **Fine Wine Good Spirits opens at new location in Lehighton** **Fine Wine Good Spirits opens at new location in Lehighton** **Fugitive from justice nabbed, jailed in Carbon** **Fugitive from justice nabbed, jailed in Carbon** Manage Subscriptions Contests Forms TV Listings Rates Classified Ads Legal Notices Contact Us Forms Feedback and Suggestions Weekly Newspapers Phone: 800-443-0377
